I'm usually hard to please when it comes to burgers, so I didn't get my hopes up when I discovered the location was insife a mall. Back in the states, food court grub just ain't the best. The food was super good here though! The burger wasnt overcooked, the staff behind the counter were awesome, and the flavor was perfect. I got the Wagyu Burger and cheese fries, and my friend got the truffle fries. The truffle really pops! If I go back to Singapore, I'll for sure stop by again.

Ordered the double wolf burger and added egg and bacon. It was one of the best burgers I've ever had. This place is in a food court and was super crowded on a Thursday evening -- took a while to find a table. Also it took about 30 minutes for my burger to be ready after ordering. The staff were trying their best but it was really slammed.

I'm not a burger person which is why I was impressed by the chicken burger here. Good quality ingredients, delicious, filling. My friends had beef burgers which they enjoyed too. Kimchi fries were not so good though. The fries were thin and airy (i guess it's the generic frozen kind) and the sauce was average.

Came across Wolf Burgers at Pasarbella on a day I was meant to have a salad. I have no regrets on this one. I never say No to a burger experience. Prices are very reasonable.The Wolf was my first try and what made me fall in love with first bite. They suggested to go with Medium rare which makes the patty a melt-in-your-mouth-experience. The combination of the beef juices, cheddar cheese and caramelised onions all soaking the bun, makes it one of my favourite burgers in Singapore. Your hands will get messy, so make sure to have napkins on hand. Tried the Buttermilk Fried Chicken on another occasion. The salted egg mayo and homemade slaw makes all the difference and what puts it above other chicken type burgers I've had from other joints. I can't fully describe this as you have to try it to be the judge. Side of sweet potato fries never goes wrong, but I've always struggled to finish it cos the burgers make me 3/4 full. Staff is friendly. Price is reasonable. Even if Pasarbella is crowded, if you have patience...wait til you get a table, otherwise, have it to go.

Came here after a day of hiking and we're craving burgers. It was a little hard to find but once we followed other reviews that said it's located inside a little food court type place, we found it. Lots of other food options in the same food court--drinks, ice cream, coffee, other main meals. The burgers were good though nothing special, but the truffle Parmesan fries were delicious and so were the sweet potato fries. We also got a chocolate shake but weren't digging the crumbled malt balls on top.

Holy shit their magic shrromz burger is just amazing. The meat is just perfect and the truffle hits you like a truck when you take the first bite. Their basic burger is not too bad, but it really can't beat their mushroom one. The salted egg yolk butter milk fried chicken isn't too bad either, but not really super salted egg yolks.

This is a really great cafe/ restaurant in Telok AyerThe food here is delicious but kind of pricey. However they do give decently large portion sizes so that makes up for it. I shared the bruschetta board with all three kinds on there. They really loaded on the lox and other toppings. I ordered their watermelon orange juice and while it was nice I probably wouldn't order it again. The Amoy food center is just around the corner and has the same drink for a fraction of the cost. They do have self serve water which was nice and cool. It really helped to combat the hot weather. My friend ordered the idea bulb which was super cute and really went well with the decor. It was expensive but you can keep the bulb as a souvenir. They do have an extensive menu that ranges from bruschetta to protein shakes and a full bar so make sure you take a thorough look at everything. The inside looks as if a hoarder decorated it but in a very chic retro way. I loved the clusters of interns and lights hanging from the ceiling. We ended up sharing a long table with another group but it was completely comfortable. The tables were a little too close to each other but they do have storage space underneath each table so that bags don't block the way. It was really busy here during the lunch rush but after 12:45 it started clearing up.

What an adorable cafe/bar. Stumbled upon this while walking about Chinatown. Friendly staff, creative drinks. You get to keep the idea bulb when you order the Drinkable Idea, which has coconut water, some sort of jelly(?) and goji berries. They also first place the drink on top of a light making it super fun! The place is retro and funky and used to be a clinic, of which they've kept the original signs in Chinese as the storefront.

Excellent cafe in the Telok Ayer area. It's hard to spot as there is no sign but look for a buddy place with staff wearing awesome TShirts and you will know you have arrived. I've had the my awesome salad and sandwich and both are amazing. Also have tried the upside down cake which was delicious too. Will be back to try more stuff.

This is one of our favorite lunch places. Great atmosphere, great good. Friendly service. Always busy. We had the awesome sandwich, which is like a tasting platter af smaller sandwiches. Highly recommend. The vegeterian awesome salad was very good. We had the drinkable idea. We are not a huge fan of coconut water but you get to keep the the light bulb. Go here. You won't be disappointed.

This is a great casual bar-cafe/restaurant near the Telok Ayer MRT station. Â Two friends/coworkers and I stopped by here for an afternoon beer and snack. Â Despite a robust food, beverage and dessert menu, the beer selection was limited, and we didn't try the food. Â However, the staff and service were amazingly fun and friendly. Â The entire cafe has a positive fun energy. Â Perhaps it's the name, the decorative interior (with the paper mache balloon, antique Chinese herbal medicine cabinets, fun signage, etc), the outdoor seating, or the friendly staff but whatever the magic, My Awesome Cafe is an awesome place to check out.
Laid back spot to chat with friends or just people watch. Â You can get a nice ice cream and espresso for $7, which isn't too bad considering the neighborhood!
If your in the CBD looking for some breakfast or brunch it's well worth the visit. Tasty western/local fare in a quaint setting. Friendly customer service at pretty affordable prices!

The Good: Â :: it's a local business Â :: great ambiance. very casual and fun without being obnoxiously, overly trendy. love it that they kept the original outside clinic markings and signage! Â :: service is friendly, fast, and efficient Â :: lots of seating. i recommend, though, that you sit closest to the street to allow you for some fun people-watching Â :: they take multiple forms of payment Â :: food is very very delicious and healthy. i can't recommend the smoked duck breast enough! perfectly done, so tender, and so flavorful. if duck isn't your thing, they have plenty of other offerings that will satisfy your palette.  Â :: cannot recommend enough any of their fresh-squeezed juices. the watermelon juice, for example, is extremely refreshing and has no added sugar. my personal favorite!The Bad: Â :: noneThe Ugly: Â :: noneWould I go back? Most certainly yes! It's now one of my go-to's while I'm out here in Singapore. This place is IN.

This cafe is very cool! Food is better than I expected, My Awesome Salad is very impressive, delicious indeed! Beef burger is also good, large portion, full of cheese. Juice is better than coffee. Decor and the service are also nice! Will definitely come back again!

There are many awesome things to point out, from the excellent customer service to the fresh, delicious dishes. We tried the awesome breakfast, and awesome sandwich, and both were equally yummy and satisfying! Freshly squeezed juices and coffees were also on point! By day it's a cool cafe inside an old Chinese medical hall, and by night it becomes a chilled bar with reasonably priced drinks (by sgp standards anyway) I see why they have regulars coming back!

Not so awesome experience for me and my friend. In fact it was awful. Their menu is ridiculously complicated, it's almost as if you'd have to solve a puzzle to get a meal, but not even a fun one because the food was terrible. My friend got a cold salad instead of the sandwich form he asked for. When he asked the waiter to change it, their suggestion was to put the salad inside some bread and call it a day! My acai icecream tasted like dirt. The beer was ok but I had better. What was worse, when we asked for the manager, he came and didn't even know what was in the menu. I'm surprised people come here, it's a hot mess.

Nothing beats a good ol' fashion American burger...with the exception of the duck confÃ­t burger. Visiting from the US and I had no clue what to choose. The staff was super helpful and easily helped me decide from drink to meal. Glad I made the decision to stop and eat here. Great staff! Great food! Great ambience! Even grabbed a t-shirt and magnet as a souvenir of Singapore

The Good: Â :: it's a local business Â :: great ambiance. very casual and fun without being obnoxiously, overly trendy. love it that they kept the original outside clinic markings and signage! Â :: service is friendly, fast, and efficient Â :: lots of seating. i recommend, though, that you sit closest to the street to allow you for some fun people-watching Â :: they take multiple forms of payment Â :: food is very very delicious and healthy. i can't recommend the smoked duck breast enough! perfectly done, so tender, and so flavorful. if duck isn't your thing, they have plenty of other offerings that will satisfy your palette.  Â :: cannot recommend enough any of their fresh-squeezed juices. the watermelon juice, for example, is extremely refreshing and has no added sugar. my personal favorite!The Bad: Â :: noneThe Ugly: Â :: noneWould I go back? Most certainly yes! It's now one of my go-to's while I'm out here in Singapore. This place is IN.
Environment is nice, service is also good; meanwhile foods can not reach my expectations.

So many wonderful options on the menu!Really enjoyed the salad with avocado, almonds, salmon and capers. Everything is really fresh, healthy and delicious. Excited to come back and try something else before I leave Singapore!

I had what was probably the greatest salad ever here. My Awesome Salad is packed with proteins (smoked salmon, chicken, ham) and it comes with half an avocado and a bread with pesto. It was so good because it had everything I love on a salad (meat)! The price would be a bit steep for a salad, but since it has that much meat on it I was willing to pay the price. I went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't crowded at all and I didn't feel too awkward because there were other solo diners there besides me. It's a nice casual spot to get something good to eat.

There are many awesome things to point out, from the excellent customer service to the fresh, delicious dishes. We tried the awesome breakfast, and awesome sandwich, and both were equally yummy and satisfying! Freshly squeezed juices and coffees were also on point! By day it's a cool cafe inside an old Chinese medical hall, and by night it becomes a chilled bar with reasonably priced drinks (by sgp standards anyway) I see why they have regulars coming back!

The food was 3 out of 5. We went for breakfast and the the options were very limited. Toast with cheese and bacon was tasty. Unfortunately the service was brutal. It wasn't very busy, maybe 50% full. Took forever to order, they forgot to bring out entire our order and brought the bill before complete meal was brought to us. The server dropped food off at the table and bolted, couldn't ask her for anything. Such a bummer because it is a cute spot.
Great healthy food with wifi. Loved the $6.50 yogurt bowl with frozen or fresh fruit. Add honey for some extra sweetness!
Amazing cafe!! The staff was great, super accommodating for a vegan and the frozen acai was delicious

Had awesome salad, beast brioches burgers and a wrap. Food is good and yummy, however it is quite pricey. The cafe is very small and squeezy, (DEFINITELY AVOID LUNCH HOURS especially on a weekday). Pretty friendly service.

My new favorite spot for an awesome salad, it has Duck Rillettes, smoked Salmon and herb chicken on fresh greens. Authentic French cafe!! The owner Franck cane around checked on us and treated us to a complimentary piece of cake as a treat. They have free wifi so I finished some work over an iced Latte. It doesn't get much better,I will be back weekly!

I guess three times is the charm. My two previous visits were two to forget, but the place is outside my front door and one of few in the neighbourhood open on Sundays; out of convenience Ihad to give it one more try. Service was prompt and the food was good. Â The ambiance is excellent and the popularity of the place, Â and the fact that it was in a startup phase, Â might have something to do with my previous poor experiences of the place. The proprietor seems to have managed to get a stable and properly trained staff. Â I'll be back again.

Nothing beats a good ol' fashion American burger...with the exception of the duck confÃ­t burger. Visiting from the US and I had no clue what to choose. The staff was super helpful and easily helped me decide from drink to meal. Glad I made the decision to stop and eat here. Great staff! Great food! Great ambience! Even grabbed a t-shirt and magnet as a souvenir of Singapore

Had walked past this place a few times and read about it online but had never had the chance to visit. Actually, my first thought when I heard about this place was "what a corny name for a cafe". The Chinese name is a literal translation, which doesn't really help... But maybe they are trying to be ironic in a hipster way that I'll never understand? But corny name aside, the food was good, so I shan't harp on it.We had the My Awesome Salad and the Parma Ham Sandwich (with brie added on). I loved the sandwich, the bread was soft and warm, yet crispy on the sides. They were generous with their ingredients and it was very tasty. Same for the salad, it came with a large serving of smoked salmon, roasted chicken and tuna mayonnaise. My only gripe was that the avocado was a bit raw. We were here after spin class down the road so it was a good thing that their food portions were huge- we were starving! It was a good deal and really unexpected as each dish is only about $15-20 on average.Decor is... Interesting. Red paper lanterns galore, high stools made of pipes, desks turned into dining tables. The air conditioning (either that or the very powerful fans) was adequate, but just barely. SUMMARY: quirky decor, very good bread, portions are huge for the price ($15-20). Would visit again!

Came here on a Monday night, and this place was bathed in red light, from the red lanterns on top. Felt like I was in a bad Hong Kong movie circa 1980s. So, the food. I didn't have any drinks 'cept water here. I had an Awesome vegetarian salad, which wasn't super awesome in terms of taste, but awesome in terms of size. It was HUGE! On a bed of mesclun greens, was half an avocado, a boiled egg, some grilled eggplant (which they substituted my hated bell peppers out with), tomatoes, and brie cheese. I found the salad impossible to eat alone, and my companion had to help me out. The salad was also bathed in a very oily dressing, which I quickly tired of.After my very huge salad, I wanted something sweet, so bread and butter pudding it was. Nothing to shout about, 3/5. I did like the ambience here, with the remodelled school desks, retro yet industrial feel, but the red lights.have.got.to.stop.

So many wonderful options on the menu!Really enjoyed the salad with avocado, almonds, salmon and capers. Everything is really fresh, healthy and delicious. Excited to come back and try something else before I leave Singapore!
Environment is nice, service is also good; meanwhile foods can not reach my expectations.

Okay, I love the bread here so much I'm writing this review as I chow down. Â This place just opened last week and they bake their own bread fresh every day!! Â My chicken breast sandwich was as fresh as can be, tasty, and very reasonably priced.Besides their soft breads, this place has damn good service. Â Just getting one of these two things at a cafe is rare in Singapore, so having both in the same place makes this place truly AWESOME.

The passion of several entrepreneurs, who has worked in various sectors including F&B, advertising, hotels and even in fitness lead to the formation of an industrial-chic cafe called My Awesome Cafe. Most of them, including the owner Franck Hardy, has brought their expertise in working in restaurants, cafÃ©s and hotels over (and yes some even worked in Michelin-star restaurants / cafÃ©s before!).Located below the creative agency Mangham Gaxiola, it occupies the what previously is Chung Hwa Free Clinic and specializes in all-day breakfast, salads, sandwiches, coffees, teas, beers and liquor. They are also the only place in Singapore to sell Mexican Coca-Cola for the long term (read: Coca-Cola with Cane Sugar! The first being Omakase Burger but was only available for a limited time)The food menu is rather diverse!And the drinks menu! (they have Mexican Coca-Cola here!)The Croissant with Scrambled Eggs and Smoked Salmon ($8++) is easily one of the better tasting breakfast food out there. The croissant is filled with strips of cheese and the smoked salmon, which was smoked to the right texture and taste. The scrambled eggs, however, tasted slightly more like an omelette instead but still maintains its moist texture.The coffee served here are blends made from Columbian, Brazilian and Sumatran beans. The Latte ($4.50++) is full bodied and maintains the strong taste of the roasting process. Anyone who does not like bitterness may not like this even as the right amount of milk is added into the coffee.In overall, this place will surely attract the crowds with their passion and patriotism to the food and service served here. If you are around the CBD / Tanjong Pagar / Telok Ayer area, why not pop by this place? I know I would, and will try the Mexican Coca-Cola the next time round!

I was on my way to Chinatown and needed food and to escape some pending rain so I stopped in. I thought the food was a little bit expensive, but it was a great lunch. The meal had a very light European feel to it. I had the ham sandwich which was served open face on baguette with a piece of very good ham on each slice of bread. The side salad was very nice and the yogurt & granola with pin alp slices seemed odd, but really was a nice side / ending to the meal. I had a great cup of tea as well.If I would have realized how close I was to Chinatown, I might have passed this place up for some cheaper fare, but I'm glad that I didn't.

Came here on a Monday night, and this place was bathed in red light, from the red lanterns on top. Felt like I was in a bad Hong Kong movie circa 1980s. So, the food. I didn't have any drinks 'cept water here. I had an Awesome vegetarian salad, which wasn't super awesome in terms of taste, but awesome in terms of size. It was HUGE! On a bed of mesclun greens, was half an avocado, a boiled egg, some grilled eggplant (which they substituted my hated bell peppers out with), tomatoes, and brie cheese. I found the salad impossible to eat alone, and my companion had to help me out. The salad was also bathed in a very oily dressing, which I quickly tired of.After my very huge salad, I wanted something sweet, so bread and butter pudding it was. Nothing to shout about, 3/5. I did like the ambience here, with the remodelled school desks, retro yet industrial feel, but the red lights.have.got.to.stop.

I like this place. It definitely has its kinks to be worked out - every single [3] visit something on mine or my friends' orders has been wrong. But when pointed out the issue is always quickly resolved. People make mistakes - it's all in how you handle them, I say. The salads are great for lunch or a light dinner, though on the pricey side ($15++, addt'l $3 for cheese on the My Awesome Salad making it $18++). Still tasty enough for me to order the salad on every visit, I just can't make this a regular weekly stop for lunch.The happy hour specials are good for the CBD in my opinion (somewhere ~$35 for a bottle of wine, if memory serves, and something for beer and bubbly too). I wish you didn't have to queue up by the kitchen in order to pay at the end, as I feel massively in the way of the staff running back and forth with dishes of food which I could knock into. Not sure I can think of a more efficient process given the layout (and it does cut down on the time to pay as there's no need to flag down a server to get your bill) - just something for the cafe to consider.

I guess three times is the charm. My two previous visits were two to forget, but the place is outside my front door and one of few in the neighbourhood open on Sundays; out of convenience Ihad to give it one more try. Service was prompt and the food was good. Â The ambiance is excellent and the popularity of the place, Â and the fact that it was in a startup phase, Â might have something to do with my previous poor experiences of the place. The proprietor seems to have managed to get a stable and properly trained staff. Â I'll be back again.
Ordered a croissant + scrambled eggs + ham & cheese.Partner had the same with smoked salmon.So bad. Scrambled eggs were so watery that it made the croissant soggy... Will not be returning

This place has cool lights and figurines resembling Ultraman. That's about it. Â Their sandwiches for lunch are bland, at 13 a pop -- stingy with meat or salmon and are dry. Drinks are overpriced. They price a $5 can of boddington ale from coldstorage at $18. They forgot orders. Same experience as prior reviewer that the proprietor does a good job but the other waiters were a disaster. They could do so much better if they improved the food quality, expanded the menu, added better beers and wines to their selection, and dropped their current crop of waiters. 2 out of 5 for food, 4 out of 5 for atmosphere, 1 for service.
