This place is very reasonably price. Â We had 6 dishes and they all tested very decent. Â During peak hours 6 - 8, expect a long line. Â Come after 8 and the crowd start thinning down. Â All their seafood dishes are excellent.
Very tasty white pepper crab, it doesn't looks good but it is delicious, the third floor noodles looks creepy but taste good, very reasonable prices but good food, highly recommended

Good food but service is so so. We are one of the first group to enter the restaurant but it took a while for them to take our orders. There is long interval between the dishes and we have to keep asking the waitress where is our food; between the first and last dish, we waited for about 45 minutes. Will be back again but probably not during the weekends. Recommended to make a reservation, and note that they hold the reservation for 5 minutes only; good to be there early. The white pepper crabs is still the best in town!

Great place if you're a heartlander, GOOD food, questionable waiters/waitresses and a rather backward atmosphere. All for heartland eating but definitely did not enjoy the waitress constantly brushing me aside to write an order down on the table. Definitely could do better but do not expect too much in terms of service. Maybe it was I who did not voice out my displeasure with being brushed against with a wet arm. Great food and great price though!

Very legit seafood place if you are ok with the atmosphere (eating in an alley), I ordered: 1) white pepper crab - must get, very flavorful but you will have to get your hands dirty. 2) garlic clams - so good! Get this and be happy 3) salted egg prawn with corn - I have never tasted anything like this, I would order this for a try and the corn is addicting. 4) fish skin with pickled veggies - not my fave nth people like it5) fried eggplant and potatoes - really enjoyed this with the sauce and combo of potatoes and eggplant
The Singapore fried noodles were amazing. The white pepper crab was solid, but not work getting your hands ad dirty as it demanded. The sweet pork thing was really good.
I found it very interesting to eat in an alley. And JB Ah Meng serves up seriously amazing san luo mee hoon and salted egg prawns! Highly recommended!

The best kind of alleys to eat in are in Geylang: you never know what will happen. It's a little ramshackle, gritty and dirty -- which is why I love it so. It's real! And Geylang is awesome.Their signature dishes are the 'san lou bee hoon' (which isn't in any way like 'san lou hor fun' btw -- different 'lou'). Also known as "three storeys bee hoon". It's not like any beehoon you've ever had. It's fried, with all the lovely 'wok hei' bits, and it's flat. Flattened like a pancake. I don't know why. But it's great.The salted egg prawn balls are gorgeous too, with little bits of corn in the batter. The fried fish skin. OMG. And the white pepper crabs!

address: 1 Pasir Ris Close E hub Downtown East Singapore 519599 Singapore
comment: This is one of my favorite restaurants. My family and I are very loyal customers, and there will always be a couple of dishes we'd order every time we're there.I really love their steamed fish. It comes to the table bubbling in a wonderful lemon, garlic and chilli padi gravy. It's so refreshing and the fish is so soft. Depending on which portion you take, it will take up at least a quarter of the table- that big! I strongly recommend diners to try it. Â Their Fried Baby Squid is super crunchy, fried in Thai chili sauce. It's addictive and goes so great with rice. Stuffed Chicken thigh (or is it drumstick?) is so good- chicken and I don't know what else is stuffed in the drumstick (completely covered!) and fried. Each piece is so fat, juicy and oh-so-nice. Black Pepper Beef Hotplate is another winner; heaps of sliced beef slathered in a thick, punching black pepper sauce, all sizzling. The onions added the sweetness and was a welcome addition.Do save room in your stomach for desserts, especially the tapioca with coconut milk. It's rich, sweet and creamy, served warm. Red Ruby is good too, bright red crunchy jewels in coconut milk and crushed ice.Come to Magic Wok for a (large) taste of Thailand at affordable prices! (And seriously, don't go alone- go with at least a friend to share around the huge portions and be able to sample more dishes) ;D

address: 1 Pasir Ris Close E hub Downtown East Singapore 519599 Singapore
comment: Casual dining. Price is reasonable, suitable to eat alone or as a family. Good variety on the menu as well. Food is nice. Only thing was food didn't come out all or at least one after the other so ended up eating most of the food before last dish arrive and the rice set that came last so one person ended eating on his own

address: 1 Pasir Ris Close E hub Downtown East Singapore 519599 Singapore
comment: Love this place. Family oriented kinda place, and it is easy on the pocket. Menu has a big range and we love their fried rice. Reasonably priced for a big family like mine! As the kitchen is a little small, when it is too crowded, food can be a bit slow at times. But well worth the wait cos its affordable and nice to eat!

address: 799 New Upper Changi Rd #03-35 Singapore 467351 Singapore
comment: Awesome awesome food! Â Spicy, flavorful, satisfying. Just enough spice to get the heartrate going, but not too much to pant. Â Burning noodles is the best.

address: 50 East Coast Rd Level 2 Singapore 428769 Singapore
comment: We had the best lunch here!!! They have a weekday special for 50% off dim sum lunches and an amazing coconut custard dessert! I was really blown away by the service and the amazing food! The dessert was very light and refreshing, not at all what I expected (past experiences). It was also just the right amount of sweet. Sorry, I forgot to take pictures of the delicious dim sum (too busy eating!) I cannot recommend this place enough!

address: 50 East Coast Rd Level 2 Singapore 428769 Singapore
comment: Had a really good meal here with some coworkers from the company. Â This place serves pretty traditional Chinese food: Peking duck, steam fish, chili crab, and etc. Â Everything was well above average. Â I'm not really sure about the value since I didn't even get a chance to see the bill, but I would imagine it's going to be on the expensive side since it's located right inside a hotel.Of of all the dishes that night, I would have to say the highlight was the Peking duck and the chili crab. Â Both had fantastic flavors and excellent execution. Â For the Peking duck, the pancake was incredibly thin and made bite sized. Â The sauce on the chili crab was so good! Â They also service some fried mantou so that people can dip some bread and soak up all that deliciousness.

address: 50 East Coast Rd Level 2 Singapore 428769 Singapore
comment: Great food! Chili crab and their soup in mini claypot is a must!

address: 50 East Coast Rd Level 2 Singapore 428769 Singapore
comment: Decided to have dim sum brunch during our family outing to East Coast Park last month and we headed over to the closest decent hotel in the vicinity. Dim sum here is not extensive in terms of variety but the you will get the basic stuffs i.e. siew mai, har gao, etc. The food was fresh but somewhat lacking in taste. Service was OK. Would expect the price to be competitive given the location and quality of food but unfortunately not.It'll be hard for us to return unless we are in the vicinity again and craving for dim sums.

address: 50 East Coast Rd Level 2 Singapore 428769 Singapore
comment: Sometimes Cantonese dining downtown can be such a bitch. Not an "East-sider", I never ventured much to this side of town. Jia Wei is a delightful modern Cantonese restaurant; its set lunches are impeccable. Great soups! I love everything here.

rest_name: Goodyear Seafood Village - Pontian Bak Kut Teh
comment: The food here is great, but the only thing I hate is the access, no proper parking lots as the area are for goods vehicles and trucks. What's good is the curry fish head, Â Mongolian (style) Â prawns. Service is not up to standard, but people still come in droves. The BKT is a little like the Malaysian style, but was disappointed that it lack ingredients, and only have pork ribs and garlic cloves. I must admit I do like the broth which is herbal. You can also order BBQ fish/ seafood, which is operated separately. We ordered stingray (it was huge) Â and at $25, I think it's worth it. The meat is tender and the cooking style slightly different from the hawkers outside (a bit Assam style topped with ladies fingers). Overall it was enjoyable.

rest_name: Goodyear Seafood Village - Pontian Bak Kut Teh
comment: We go there quite often on weekdays as the place is spacious and the staff were friendly with my grandchildren, helping to look after and letting me eat in peace when the restaurant is not crowded but those friendly ladies have left. Still a good place for zi char dishes especially liked the Assam Fish Head (prefer over the curry fish head). The other dishes are also good except for the Garlic Pork which when bitten into oil oozes out. Beng Poh, just next door, does a better job at this dish. I do not like the Bak Kut Teh. Reservations encouraged for weekend dinner or be prepared to wait. There's outdoor and aircon sections. Great for families. Parking is a nightmare and especially so during weekends!

rest_name: Goodyear Seafood Village - Pontian Bak Kut Teh
comment: A place for Malaysians in Singapore for a taste of home. Even the surrounding ambience makes you feel like you're across the boarder. The Bak Kut Teh tastes great if you love something other then the peppery kind . They also serve yam rice during lunch which goes great with the Bak Kut Teh. A pot of Pu Er Chinese tea to complete the dining experience . The restaurant serves freshly cooked food as well and the dishes are quite tasty. The menu ranges from fish head curry to black pepper crab. A simple dish like a salted veg Â omelette also tastes delicious . Great place for a relaxed family dinner out in a laid back environment .

rest_name: Goodyear Seafood Village - Pontian Bak Kut Teh
comment: WHERE IS THIS PLACE? AND DID IT JUMP OUT OF A TIME WARP?This joint sits just off Tampines Road. No, it's not IN Tampines, it's a really old road that links Tampines/Pasir Ris to Hougang, and it has over 10 temples along it, and it cuts through this creepy forest-y/jungle-y area next to an air force runway. I used to have a take a bus through it to get to school at 6.30am, and it was misty, and creepy and kinda mysterious. Did I mention it was creepy?Anyhow, Mum said it was recommended to her by a taxi driver, who picked her up from the land of bak kut teh (or BKT) - Balestier Road. He said this ulu (read hard to find) spot had "the best" BKT, and was a favourite with his taxi driver friends.I guess we had to try it. Plus it was kinda near our house. Amazingly there was a day when the parents were home, and I'd freed up some time over lunch, so off we went.Thankfully, the road's only creepy in the dark, but at lunch, it seemed like a different world - it looked like we had gone to Malaysia... one that was 15 minutes from my house.But of course the moment they came to take our orders, they dispelled all the quiet-small-town-blast-from-the-past myths... the auntie took our orders on the new iPad. And she sent our orders to the kitchen via wifi. And the cash register was set up with an iPad too. Oh. My. Wow.After I reset my dropped jaw, we had some BKT, and also had a bunch of other sides, including Mei Cai Kou Rou, Hong Kong Kai Lan, and salted/pickled vegetables too. Now the BKT soup was a little herbal, and tasted a little Malaysian, if you know what I mean... and it was OH SO TASTY. As you dig in the $10 medium pot, you'll find it filled with pork ribs, and it's pretty good value for money! And the plump, soft cloves of garlic sitting in the soup? MEGA YUM.Now the other stuff was good too. the Mei Cai Kou Rou was braised wonderfully, and the meat was flaking apart, and the salted veg? Not overly salty, and had a little kick too, with the addition of some dried chillies. I know it sounds weird when you hear salted veg, and wonder if it can ever be too salty, but it can!It was nice to finish off the meal with some homemade barley as my eyes glazed over - as they are wont to do, after a good meal.Now one of the best parts? We paid $33 for the four of us. Not bad at all.I have to come back to try the other stuff, including the curry fishhead and the steamboat that I spied another table having. As long as I can find my way back here.

rest_name: Goodyear Seafood Village - Pontian Bak Kut Teh
comment: The BKT is quite heavy on MSG and lacks ingredients for the price. There are better ones around in the eastern Singapore.

address: 750 Chai Chee Rd #01-13 Viva Business Park Singapore 469000 Singapore
comment: I swear there's only one thing that matters when you come here and that is GIANT BOBA! You can only find these in Singapore and no other place in the world. This is one of three locations in the area that have such a thing. I must declare being the boba addict that I am this is a slice of heaven. If you add this to some good TW food it's probably the best feast you will ever have. Took me awhile for my family to drive to the joint but really worth the trip. By United States standards this is a really good deal if you are a boba addict 3 liters for a few USD is a super bargain. Just remember this rule it's not a 3 person meal if only one person enjoys it. Please don't be selfish,Note: I am not sure if we can Dabao (carry out) or not but I know another location does allow it. Just not sure about this one.

Set upon a lush, peaceful backdrop of the reservoir, this place as a sleeper vibe. Staff was super attentive. The fish tacos and waffles are good. Decently prized and portions are not measly for Singapore's standard. Get your face into their fish tacos and ice cream waffles, they're good! The rendang burger is average.Positive vibes and them treating customers like friends won me over. Definitely supporting this small business!

We stay in the area. The food is great, I love it. One of the reasons I come here is their selection of "craft beer." The reason I'm marking Burp low on this rating is because they don't replenish their stock of actual craft beer. The past 2 times I've been, they have been out of stock on 2 out of 2 IPAs that they advertise on their menu. They deserve a 4 out of 5, Â but will not get that to me until they up theirs craft beer game.

Burp Kitchen & Bar? That sounds filling already. When I heard that they are located in the East, I was even more excited, because the east side is my 'hood. Less than 5 months old, their bistro is situated at a quiet corner of a bustling area (nearer to Bedok Reservoir), well known to residents around who probably shops at the nearby Sheng Siong supermarket. The host shared that being in a neighbourhood area, they also do not believe in charging for GST and service charge. That's definitely a plus point for me. :)I loved the healthier airfried chicken wings they serve up, as well as nice burgers. I like the crabby patty burger, most of my friends like the burp beef burger. Most of what they can make in-house, they do. At least they try to make it more healthy for their patrons! They also serve brunch, so thats cool!

address: Bedok North St 3 #01-25, Kaki Bukit 511 Market And Food Centre Singapore 460511 Singapore
comment: The fried yams, five spice rolls and prawn crackers are the foundation awesomeness of this place! Their specialty chili and sweet sauces brings out even more flavour and add a layer of shiokness.The price is very reasonable, four person having this alone for dinner should expect about $25.

address: 60 Paya Lebar Rd #01-04, Paya Lebar Square Singapore 409051 Singapore
comment: This is the second outlet of Tonkotsu King by Ramen Keisuke, after the first in Orchid Hotel. It is a bigger outlet, compared to the first outlet. It was decorated in an old school japanese way, with posters around on the walls.There was free flow marinated bean sprouts and hard boiled eggs on the table to help yourself to. Remember to add DIY to ground sesame seeds, bonito powder and crispy deep fried onions to the ramen for extra kick. Ice water was served after placing order.Tonkotsu King ($12.90)Instead of usual char Siew, the ramen was served with tender pork belly. The soup was rich and creamy.Tonkotsu Ramen ($10.80++)The original pork soup base, served with the usual char siew. The char siew was big in size and very tender. The soup was rich and creamy. Although the place was packed, the turnover was fast.

address: 60 Paya Lebar Rd #01-04, Paya Lebar Square Singapore 409051 Singapore
comment: Dinner with family. Nice homely place. Not good for groups. Very limited seats. Only one high chair in whole restaurant. Food is nice though. Typical good ramen. Recommended if u are near but don't come all the way here

address: 60 Paya Lebar Rd #01-04, Paya Lebar Square Singapore 409051 Singapore
comment: A small store at the side of orchid hotel. You can get free vegetables (beans sprouts) and eggs. For preference, I did not like the soup as it wasn't that flavourful. The soup base didn't give me that pack of punch when I had my first sip. Overall its a good ramen.and affortable ramen.

address: Blk 73 Bedok South Avenue 3 #01-452 Singapore 460073 Singapore
comment: This is a great place to have late meals. As far as I know it never closes, so be it after a night out, a sports match, or if your simply feeling peckish at home, this is a great place for you! For those residing in the East, Alina's Kitchen is conveniently located on Bedok South Avenue 3. The Roti Prata comes at very reasonable prices and is of the best quality. The service is great as well, very friendly people! If you come late enough you will be able to park your car just on the side of the road, the Traffic Police won't bother you at all. Its a nice atmosphere, a very light ambiance, fantastic for a quick meal, or hang out with friends.

address: Blk 73 Bedok South Avenue 3 #01-452 Singapore 460073 Singapore
comment: This is pretty near my place an usually after football on Sundays, I'll drop by Alina's for lunch before heading home. The food is what draws me back there almost every week. They serve nasi padang, seafood and prata as well. Some of the dishes I usually order are the beef rendang and curry chicken. The service there is also pretty good. I would recommend this place for quick and affordable lunches/dinners if you;re around the bedok south area and craving some decent malay food.

address: 80 Marine Parade Road #B1-18A, Parkway Parade Singapore 449269 Singapore
comment: We visited for the first time yesterday and all three children declared it their absolute favorite. They all opted for the chicken soup base, which they preferred above the pork soup base. The free unlimited bean sprouts and hard boiled eggs were also a hit. I had the three spice ramen which went particularly well with the bean sprouts. My friend had the cheesy ramen which I would like to try next time. Children's portion of ramen free with every adult portion for children 10 and under. The gyoza was so good we ordered a second portion. We had a cosy booth in the corner. The restaurant was a little hard to find. The entrance is not from inside the Parkway Parade mall but outside along with Mos Burger. We will definitely be back again as a family.

address: 80 Marine Parade Road #B1-18A, Parkway Parade Singapore 449269 Singapore
comment: This ramen shop is a branch of the well known Keisuke Ramen chain in Singapore. It is the first outlet in the East part of Singapore. The 60 seater outlet opened in July 2014 and is based on Japanese MATSURI theme, with the place decorated in a colorful way with bright Japanese decoration around.Tonkotsu Ramen SANJA ($13.90++)Ramen with 3 different spices sauce in black, red and green.Rich with a slightly spicy soup base.Although I had selected strong soup base, it was not too salty as it was usually the case in other ramen stalls.Tonkotsu Ramen "Yukimatsuri" ($13.90++)"Miso" tonkotsu ramen with powder cheeseThe cheese melted when mixed with the hot soup, which made the soup even richer and creamier. But it also made the soup quite salty too.Served with sesame seed for one to grind to add flavour to the soup.There was also condiments such as chilli oil and vinegar on the table to help yourself to.Help yourself to the free flow hard boiled eggs and marinated bean sprouts.If you do the survey, there will be free egg for next visit. Free ice cream on your birthday.Overall food was not bad, served quite fast. It was easy to get the attention of the staffs and the place was not crowded.

address: 80 Marine Parade Road #B1-18A, Parkway Parade Singapore 449269 Singapore
comment: This ramen restaurant is located next to Mos Burger at the corner of Parkway Parade. At first we couldn't find it because we thought it would be inside the mall but you have to walk past Watson and go out to see the restaurant. I like the colourful setting. My friend and I wanted to sit at a cozy part next to the entrance but the waiter told us that it was only for four people. Fair enough. The menu and order sheet were straightforward. Seemed a bit wasteful for each customer to get one order sheet too. Maybe going digital would save paper. The nebuta ramen was flavourful and rich. The ramen egg also lived up to expectations. There's free flow of bean sprouts and hard boiled eggs. When we left and paid the bill, my friend asked me how much it was to divide between us. Before I could answer, the waitress gave an amount confidently. Her calculation turned out to be wrong though. Haha.

address: 80 Marine Parade Road #B1-18A, Parkway Parade Singapore 449269 Singapore
comment: Great little ramen joint which serves authentic and quality ramen. The broth is solid and noodles cooked to your preference. We waited about 30 mins for 2 people on a Saturday night at 6.30pm. Service is efficient. You place your order whilst you wait in the line and they serve complimentary barley tea. The place is small and seating is tight but worth it. The ramen is reasonably priced. They serve unlimited boiled eggs as well as this preserved bean sprout side. Overall I enjoyed the dining experience.

address: 80 Marine Parade Road #B1-18A, Parkway Parade Singapore 449269 Singapore
comment: Awesome ! Don't have to head down tanjong pagar to satisfy this craving no more. Love the service love the variety love the food.

address: 80 Marine Parade Road #B1-18A, Parkway Parade Singapore 449269 Singapore
comment: Opened at Parkway Parade not too long ago. Part of the Ramen Keisuke Group which runs other Tonkutsu King outlets under different branding at Suntec City, Tanjong Pagar, Amara Hotel, Bugis, etc. Their ramen is quite authentic i.e. close to those you get back in Japan - thick, tasty soup and soft ramen. Best thing here is you get free flow of hard boiled eggs and beansprouts (just in case you can't get enough of the ramen). Highly recommended!!!

Five star has always been my nbr 1 for chicken rice + zi char. Love the way they prepare the food, texture, spices, sauces and variety. Nothing too overcooked nor tough, all is right which explains my frequent visit and in all fairness, i did try other places (refer to other reviews). Someone in her review mentioned about their chicken being too dry- im not sure if she was being served beast meat or thigh but you are welcomed to inform the staff which part of the chicken you prefer. As for unfriendly staffs, as with all humans, during peak hours they can get busy trying to serve everyone but they are definitely not unfriendly. Comon, cut them some slack, they are in service line. All in all, i will be back! P.s. Their salted egg pork ribs is a must try!
Service is really good. Fast ordering. Very keen to do business. Staff well motivated. Food 7/10One of the better chicken rice but many other stores taste better.
It is what it is i.e. five star chicken rice.Chicken is always tender and tasty. One of the better hainanese chicken rice you can get in Singapore.

Spontaneously checked out this spot and I was not disappointed! Even though the prices are slightly above average (compared to hawker stands/food courts) it was still worth! The service was acceptable and the portions were larger than hawker stalls! The back room having AC was a nice bonus!I tried a few dishes and the seafood hor fun shined the brightest! Although it was good, I would rather explore other options before coming back again! I'd recommend coming thru at least once!

Smiley friendly staff is very important and Five Star has done it! You have an option to eat outside or inside fully air-conditioned(which we went with in 37 degrees weather)!! Comfortable seating, it's got everything you need if you want Â to try out authentic dishes such as, hainanese chicken,cereal prawns, tong choi (veggies) with fried shallots and shrimp paste, fish ball noodles, you name it. Â Everything tasted very good especially the cereal prawns, and had a lot of "wok hay", meaning the food was cooked very well with the chef's techniques. This restaurant is nicely situated in the Katong area, near a beach and surrounded by many other amenities. I would definitely suggest this area if you want to explore more local eats away from downtown Singapore.

Came here around 2 am since it's one of the few places in the area still operating at those hours. Â The staff was incredibly friendly and seated me right away, even though it was obvious that they are already starting to close up for the night.Ordered the Kampong chicken at 2 people's portion and Kangkong just for myself because I was mad hungry. Â The waiter was also nice enough to ask if I wanted the chicken deboned. Â Honestly, I have never been provided with this option before, and so I just kinda froze like a deer in headlights. Â Told him either way would be fine, since I have never had issue with bone and I was so hungry I probably would've just chewed through it anyway.Chicken (deboned) arrived first and it was promptly devoured. Â Texture was really tender, and it had a good natural chicken flavor without being greasy at all, even though it was served with skin. Â I'm not sure why, but chicken in US just doesn't quite have that same flavor... Â Guessing it's probably the feed and the general growing/processing method.The kangkong came a bit mushy, but it was still devoured within minutes. Â The chicken kinda stole the limelight, and I honestly can't recall much about the veggie...

We got tips from locals on best chicken and rice places. We tried all of them but the one place they left off was Five Star. Accidentally discovered this place and I'm glad I did. I would name this place as the best boiled chicken and rice place in Singapore. Not only the chicken was incredible but their super flavorful rice is what put it over the top. In addition they have other amazing authentic dishes. Definitely try their soup selection. Highly recommend it.

Mmm probably one of my favorite Singaporean dishes! My friend and I came here for dinner and ordered the hainan chicken rice with the pork ribs in egg batter (I think that's what it was called?). Super yummy and service is very much quick and efficient! When you order the chicken, you can select your cut of what kind of chicken meat you want, and it comes with some pickled vegetables and a serving of chicken soup. Seating is outdoor and there are fans everywhere so you manage to stay cool. All in all, such a delicious meal and one that I would recommend to anyone looking to try some chicken rice in Singapore!tldr; yum yum, my favorite Singaporean dish

I'm usually not much if a carb eater.... But this has got to be some of the best rice I've ever had, Â I had two servings! I nearly forgot about the chicken! The hainan rice cooked in chicken fat, Â juices, and spices along with chili and ginger mixed inside is just incredible. Chicken itself was also outstanding, very moist and flavourful! Other outstanding dishes include the baby gai lan and the fried tofu. Protip, ask for specific parts like the wing or breast only if dining alone and they can accommodate.

My favorite chicken rice place. Flavorful and not oily. Â They serve Kampong chicken which lends a unique taste. Kampong chicken tends to be smaller than commercial chicken, so you might need to order more than usual. Â Or just order more because it is soooo good.

One of the best chicken rice that lives up to their name. Trust me, I love chicken rice. I've tried more than 40 chicken rice stores from all over Singapore in a span of a year. They live up to their name, and are amongst my top 3 choice when I introduce an overseas friend to local cuisine. Five thumbs up! I'm borrowing two thumbs from my feet and one from my mum who is busy savouring her delightful chicken dipped in porridge.

A good place to go for some late-night chicken rice (especially after Tian Tian left Joo Chiat Road!)The chicken is nowhere near as fatty as the ones that Tian Tian have but the rice and chilli are excellent. And because it opens till late it's always a good option for nocturnal beings in the neighbourhood.

In my mind, there are only three contenders for best chicken rice in Singapore - the one at Tiong Bahru Market, Chin Chin, and Five Star. And given that Five Star is of closest proximity to my abode, it's no wonder that this is my first pick when poultry cravings hit. Cool, silky tender chicken atop a mound of soy sauce and sesame oil drenched cucumbers. Hot, fragrant rice. Spicy, garlicky chili. A generous serve of steaming soup. There's nothing missing in this picture, really. Sure, it's as unglamorous as they come - sitting out next to a busy road with auntie waitresses squawking orders overhead, but the bustling ambience of being in the presence of famous food is unbeatable. Price wise, it's not cheap, but neither is it exorbitant. And if only visit sporadically, it's all the more worth it to splurge, both in terms of calories and clams.
One of my favourite hainanese chicken rice in the east. The kampung chicken meat is tender and soft. Rice is cooked just right. Chilli sauce is one of the best
Generally very good chicken and rice. Sweet and sour pork was nice as well. Priced fairly. I've had better in china but I'm gonna low my standards here.
It is truly 5 star chicken!! Order their fish head curry as well. So surprised they did it well. Not most chinese restaurants do for my experience. Staff are nice and helpful in ordering

After hearing about this place for the past six years from local friends, I made it a mission to visit this place during my trip. Keep in mind this is only the second time I have had Hainanese chicken in Asia. Be prepared for quick service and lean and juicy chicken at this joint.Smooth and juicy fragrant kampong (supposedly free range) chicken with hot fragrant chicken rice. Chuck some chilli on top and that meal disappeared pretty quickly. The soup was quite salty so I only had a few sips as it was super hot in Singapore and though it was unlimited, I don't understand how one can have steaming soup in 30 degree weather.

Great chicken rice, and legit pricing. Was so hungry that night, I ordered a large portion is steamed chicken rice with only breast meat. Best decision I've made that night. Cool place to hang out for a late night supper too!!!

Came here and dined for two. Ordered their roasted chicken for two and had the hong kong kailan (the one with oyster sauce). It was a great meal. The clear soup wasn't bland, so it actually added flavor to the rice. The chili and garlic were great too. the kampong chicken was succulent and juicy, the rice was fluffy and not hard / dry. The kailan was sliced thinly, so it's not a chore to eat the stems. And the oyster sauce was generous. It was a great lunch, except for one gripe. The lady kept taking away our chili / garlic and putting it on a different table. Yaaaa I mean we've taken some in our saucers, but then every time we wanted more, we'd have to call for service for her to take the tray back to our table, then she'd take it away again. And so we had to ask for it again afterwards. So I just gave up. Haha. Sad. But that's the only thing stopping me from giving it a 5 star. Maybe there are better chicken rice places, but if you're in the katong / joo chiat area, this is definitely one to try (and compare to your favorite chicken rice place).

I purchased the haianese chicken rice and stir fry noodles for lunch. Â Although, I found the Haianese chicken rice to be good... The chicken was rather slim in meat. Â Stay away from the stir fry noodles. It was tasteless.I had the food to go but when I pass by this place it's always packed at night. Â Typically, seating is outside in the Singapore heat.

Very famous chicken rice in Singapore!!!I can't get sick of eating the chicken rice from here. Sure, it is a slightly more expensive that what you usually pay for chicken rice, but come on, it can't be more expensive than what you pay at Chatterbox! At least this tastes really good, and you pay for quality. They use kampong chicken, which means the meat is lean yet tender. Coupled with the succulent rice, everything is just about right! For a more balanced meal, you can also order other dishes such as the home-style tofu, vegetables and prawn roll. Five Star isn't famous for no reason!

Katong is known for its many eateries and this is one of the famous ones. Just a note, If you're driving, parking can be quite a problem along this stretch of road. Anyhow, 5 Star chicken rice isn't the cheapest Â stall in town but its probably among the top few in Singapore. They use kampong chickens, which supposedly have less fat content and are therefore healthier. Nevertheless, the chicken meat is tasty and tender and the rice isn't too oily. I usually ask for of the gravy that comes with the chicken because it goes well with the rice. Their Hometown Tofu is also worth trying.

Comida Mexicana is crisp, clean, cosy and cool (air-con and vibe).It was a pleasure to eat here tonight, I was craving Mexican and actually thought about travelling to Dempsey Hill to eat at Margaritas, but given that is a long distance from the East Coast, I tried to find something closer to home.I've seen Comida on Deliveroo, but until now hadn't ventured to try it, and that's been a mistake.The portion sizes are large, and the staff were helpful here as I began to order 2 dishes and my server said 1 would be enough.I went for the Mexican Yucatan Chicken, which has an orange fragrance to it and is stacked like a teepee with 4 individual skewers of succulently grilled and spiced annatto chicken.This comes in a crispy edible tortilla bowl with other salad ingredients, which you use to build 4 tacos (the flour tortilla's on the side and salad from the bowl work to contrast the sweetly marinated chicken).I also had two silver patron margaritas which were tasty without being exceptional (a habanero option would really excel here).It is on the pricier end of a Singapore meal, but I would definitely come again!

The definition of Garang (malay) could be "bold, daring, fearless, gung-ho", and that's what the food aims to be.Courtesy of the Mibrasa charcoal oven in the kitchen, everything comes out perfectly smoky and charred on the outside and moist and tender on the inside, accompanied by unique marinades.The USDA Black Angus Short Rib was glazed with gula melaka, had melt-in-your-mouth crispy fat attached, the lamb cutlets were perfectly done, not overcooked. The garang rice was similar to New Ubin's famous "heart attack" fried rice.Originally a limited time "pop-up" organized by Slake and New Ubin Seafood, it now looks like Garang Grill is here to stay. Ever since New Ubin Seafood moved to the Hillview area, it was a far trek to the west side of the island to get your zi-char and grilled meat fix. Definitely worth the calories, and welcomed by Eastsiders with open arms.

We were introduced to this restaurant by a good friend. The name of the restaurant do not reflect the Peranakan food that they serve. But boy-oh-boy if you are into Asian Fusion food this is a must try restaurant. The food is authentic and the service staff are friendly. They also serve beers from a local brewery, Brewerkz. On the wine menu they have Pierre Jean Merlot and Chardonnay. I left the ordering to my friends and we just enjoy the food. I'll let the photos do the talking. But be assured that the taste is good and authentic. Their sambal is one of the best I've tasted. Their blue rice is so fragrant and tasty that my son have 2 bowls. A rare occurrence. There are limited street parking just outside the restaurant. And if you are there for dinner you can park at a side street next to the restaurant. If you take the MRT, alight at Tanah Merah station and take bus number 2 and 9. Get off at the third stop and walk a few meters to the restaurant.

Nyonya Taste Brew & Bar is a new restaurant located along Jalan Pari Burong just a few minutes away from Tanah Merah MRT Station, serving authentic Nyonya delights, together with a wide selection of craft beers.I have never come across Nyonya Taste by brew & bar till I came across someone posting on Facebook about home delivery with no minimum order on Nyonya food. I was kind of craving for that particular cuisine, thus I decided to go all out and arrange my dinner in advance. Communication and arrangement of food was done via Whatsapp in a breeze. Here comes the rare dish which is also one of their recommended dishes, Sotong Masak Hitam, when translated from Malay Language, it literally means Sotong cooked in Squid Ink. The taste of the dish threw us a surprise with loads of slice onions, chilli added with hints of black pepper taste. We are not so much of black pepper lovers, however, the dish as a whole well cooked and the texture of the Sotong was right enough.Ayam Buah Keluak is not only on their recommended item on their food menu but also one of the staples that we will often order when it comes to Peranakan food as I simply cannot miss out the chance in having Buah Keluak Nut. This chicken dish in spicy gravy was served with 2 pieces of Buah Keluak and you have additional at $2 each. The chicken meat came in large chunks were flavourful and tasty especially when it comes to pairing the sauce with the rice. Â However, it will be better if they are cut into smaller chunks. On a side note, the Buah Keluak paste has been already extracted out from the nut and tuck into our delivery boxes together with the dish.The recommended Braised Babi Chin is actually one of my favourite dishes ordered. The dish was pretty well executed with rich flavours from the mixture of Pork Belly with mushroom, eggs and potatoes. The taste gave me a good reminiscent of home cook food in which each and every item was tender and soft, well braised. I love having the gravy over my plate of rice.Base on the food portion given (excluding the rice), we find that the amount that we paid for was rather reasonable. The portion was big enough for 3 pax or perhaps good enough for 4-5 pax. Though the food we ordered might not be appealing in the colours, taste-wise it is still appealing. Â There is always a saying that "tabao" food may not taste as good as having the food served up to us piping hot when dining in, it will be best to patronize Nyonya Taste by brew & bar again. When? I guess it when my stomach is calling for Nyonya Cuisine again.

Along this row of shophouse lies this bar-like place with a chill-out vibe. It actually belies its real hidden treasure of peranakan food. This place has a cosy atmosphere, friendly service and very good quality peranakan food. The fish maw soup is really awesome from all the spice you've had from peranakan food. The chicken keluat dish serves 2 super large candlenuts which I've never seen had so much blackie meat inside before. It's like mining peranakan black gold!The beef rendang is the highlight of my night here. It's extremely soft tender and the rendang tastes doesn't overpower, which I feel uncomfortable when I've had one. The taste is just right for me.Highly recommend this place! Bonus: NO GST!

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: They say that Geylang has some of the best food in Singapore, and Little Vietnam is representative of one of those. It's surprising how difficult it is to find good and cheap Vietnamese food in Singapore considering how close it is to Vietnam. Even the Vietnamese food all the way in the Bay Area is often better and cheaper.Little Vietnam is the only saving grace. Fresh, quality ingredients and authentic-tasting Vietnamese food at reasonable prices (currently no GST or service charge) makes this one of my favorite haunts to frequent. They have some unique Vietnamese dishes that can't be found anywhere else.They have a good selection of salads like papaya salad and peanut salad. The banh xeo and claypot fish were very delicious as well. They also had some great drinks like the passionfruit juice and vietnamese coffee. You can order to your heart's content and not feel guilty about burning a hole in your wallet or clogging your arteries.

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: Wow, this place really does get busy! I popped by today for lunch and the place was packed!So I nabbed myself a seat for one and had the beef and brisket pho with fresh coconut juice. The pho was served in a giant bowl but was not completely filled. It looked like a lot but I easily polished off the bowl and probably could have done with more rice noodles and broth. Also, I noted some small bits of cooked chicken which was a bit unnerving when I discovered this at the end of my meal. The broth was subtle but incredibly well flavoured. There was a good amount of meat added to the dish but I was surprised that the usual additions that come on the side were already added into the soup. The young coconut was fresh and was a refreshing addition to my meal. Very reasonably priced totalling $11.50. Overall really good and the broth was the standout.

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: Pretty rough experience. If we could do half stars, I would. For the record, we are American tourists here in Singapore so excuse us if we are ignorant of what is commonplace here.For starters, charging guests for a cup of tap water, without letting us know. Again, I don't know if that's the norm for restaurants here but it isn't in most restaurants we've been to abroad or in the states. We paid for three cups of tap water. Tea had a charge too but that we can let slide. At least let us know.Then a waitress brought out an extra bowl of pho that we did not order. We politely told her that we did not order it and to bring it back to the kitchen, which she did. Later, the original waitress who took our order in the beginning came back to argue with us, and tried to convince us that we did in fact order that bowl of pho. She even brought the bowl of pho back out as if it amounted to any sort of evidence. It didn't look like she wanted to leave without forcing us to take the bowl so we relented, having better things to do with our busy itinerary.We thought the worst of it was over but the whole time we were eating, we could hear them talking amongst themselves in Vietnamese right at the counter, arguing back and forth about that damn bowl of pho; whether to take it back, to leave it there, wondering if we were going to eat it or to charge us for it. (Of course we were going to pay for it). It sounded as if they were not at all concerned if we understood them or not but I'm pretty sure they know we can understand them because they took our damn order in Vietnamese. They wouldn't leave the matter alone and kept bickering about it and kept mentioning us in a rude manner. It ruined our appetite and greatly upset us to have this as our first interaction with the locals here in Singapore. Left a bad taste in our mouth, literally. I'd avoid this place at all costs if this is how they treat their customers, especially customers who even chose to foot the bill of the restaurant's mistakes.

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: This place gets so crazy busy that it is better to come early if you do not want to wait in line.Not sure why the long line though. The food is ok, but nothing spectacular. It falls into the category of "I don't mind eating it but I won't think about returning". We were a big group and we tried a variety of dishes. Apart from the pho, the bun, both fresh and fried spring rolls (fried ones are better), we also tried the carrot cake (like a plainer version of our local white carrot cake), quails (4 tiny birds for $15 but tasty with some ice cold beers), cockles, gong gong, etc.On a breezy evening, it is nicer to sit outside where you get the evening breeze (plus some traffic smoke). There's parking in the building itself.

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: Total B.S.... They advertise that they close at 11:30pm. i arrive at 10:30pm sharp and they say kitchen closed. I told them i took a 20 min Uber to eat here and they said "no." They then said i can order a tea. Unheard of. This place absolutely sucks.

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: It was 5 years ago, my first time to visit this restaurant, I was amazed by the food here , so I went here so many times in the past 5 years. I love this restaurant which let me feel complete my day after the meal , really good . Worth to try the Vietnamese food .

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: Anthony P is so right about this place. Â Indeed a little Vietnam in Singapore. Â Place was packed even when we got here at 7:30pm. Â Pho is wonderful with excellent broth and medium rare beef. Â Prices are reasonable service efficient. Â Hits for us were the bbq quail, carrot cake, cane prawn, pho the misses were the boil fish, cabbage chicken salad. Â Again all in all a good recommendation and a new found place for pho at least for us.

address: 511 Guillemard Rd #01-25 Grandlink Square Singapore 399849 Singapore
comment: We have been here a few times. Wish we had discovered the place earlier. Legit Viet food and you don't have to go down to Joo Chiat

"Moo" means pork, "Kata" means skillet. Originated from Chiang Mai, it uses pork lard instead of the usual oil or butter. A combination of a Korean BBQ and Chinese Hot pot. We ordered a set of 4 that consists of a combination of meat and seafood. Quality of meat and service is better than other mookata places I've been, especially when you can eat comfortably in an air conditioned environment. Set for 2: $34.90Set for 4: $68.90Meat Lover's Platter: $74.90Seafood Catches: $54.90
So glad to be able to dine-in again. Quality of food and service is the same (that God for that). Never mind paying more for this compared to other mookata eateries.

I used to live nearby and often ate there. I haven't been back in awhile because I moved abroad but I made sure to go back when I was in Singapore last month. I love this BBQ place and love the fact that it's a mix of BBQ and Steamed Boat. It's also nice to see that they have renovated it a little and the exhaust system is better then it used to be. What is the highlight there? Definitely their sauce!! I crave for it and wish I could find it where I live now.

This is 3.5 stars for me, but I will round up to 4 because the staff are nice!I'm very new to the Thai BBQ scene. In fact, I never realised that "mookata" loosely translates to "pork skillet" in Thai (at least, this is what a light search on the interwebs tells me.)In a way, the mookata style kills two birds in one stone, as the grill is part BBQ, part steamboat. I'm more of a griller than a soup person, so I just stuck to the grilling part. Since the grill is dome-shaped, I found it a bit difficult to operate because my food would always slide down and end up in the soup! But this is truly a first world problem.We ordered a mix of beef, chicken, pork, and mushrooms (wrapped in bacon since it's a lot healthier that way.) I'm not sure how it was seasoned, but whatever they put in there made the meats taste pretty good. Add in the 3 dipping sauces (ranging from mild to Thai chilli hawt) and all was well with the world.We came here for a late lunch, so there weren't too many people there and the staff was very quick to come out with everything. I wouldn't mind coming back here and perfecting my Thai grilling skills, especially since I'll be living nearby now!

Had dinner here for my mom's birthday. Generous portions for the set meal, staff wasn't really that friendly so that's kind of a turn off. The broth was a little bland but all together we had a nice dinner. Worth a try but I won't be coming back.

We had a business get together with Ken & BM. Had the 2 to share with soup and BBQ. Ken already had dinner and brought mooncakes for dessert. Broth was tasty and meat cooked easily on the heat. Well seasoned meat. Had 2 coconut water and a Bandung drink. Cost $55. Bit noisy and hot but the food was enjoyed by BM who was having hot pot for first time.

Ive been a fan of this Mookata for quite long now. i like how they marinated the pork collar. I really like the taste. I am very delighted with the couple who runs this business.There is a month which i and my family dine almost every week and managed to meet the owner. theyre very friendly and really approachable.I decided to celebrate my birthday there and when i settle my bill i was surprise that the couple recognize me and gave me a 40% discount on my total bill.It was very kind of them. really generous i say. You acknowledge and know how to take care of your regular customer.Keep it up and God bless!Again thumbs up!

address: 11 Changi Coast Walk NSRCC Sea Sports Centre Singapore 499740 Singapore
comment: 4-stars for the view, 3-stars for the food.Basically, zi char (ç®ç) with a view. Food-wise, it's nothing to write home to your momma about. All the favorites are served here, fish head curry, chilli crab, fried hor fun (flat rice noodles), sambal kangkong (water spinach in spicy sauce). They do a fairly decent rendition of the dishes with similar quality to regular coffee shop zi char.The main thing about being here is dining outside with an ocean view. Great place to enjoy the sea breeze and watch the sun set, beer (and crab shell) in hand. Make reservations early to score a good seat that faces the sea. The name "Belly View" comes from the planes that take off from the Changi Airport runway and fly low overhead every few minutes.This restaurant is located within the NSRCC Sea Sports Center, on the left side of the boat ramp if you're facing the ocean. (There are two restaurants here, one is Belly View and the other is Stella on the right side of the boat ramp.)It's a bit tough to get here via public transport; taxi, ride-hailing services will work. For those who drive, parking is free. :)

address: 11 Changi Coast Walk NSRCC Sea Sports Centre Singapore 499740 Singapore
comment: I came to realize why this place is name Belly view, and it's a pretty cute reason why. You get to see the belly view of airplanes as they fly over this dining place. The Zi char here is pretty good. Tried the cereal prawns, spinach dish, chicken dish and a few others. The above few I mentioned are tasty and well cooked. Overall a nice place to dine at, good for family gatherings too. Do come earlier to enjoy the sunset view and avoid crowds.

address: 11 Changi Coast Walk NSRCC Sea Sports Centre Singapore 499740 Singapore
comment: Belly View Cafe is an obscure Chinese zi char place located at NSRCC Sea Sports Centre. It was a random visit one weekend because we didn't want to travel to the nearby malls in the East for dinner and this place is really quiet. You'll need to drive or cab if you want to dine here. Otherwise, you could try cycling here from Changi Village. Work for your food my friends! Dine out on the wooden deck which overlooks the sea. Listen to the crashing waves on the sea wall and watch the planes fly by every 2 mins or so (we timed them!). That's also why it's called Belly View. :) How we wished we were on a plane out. The food is simple but well executed Chinese food at hawker prices. You can trust the aunty for recommendations. I'd say order the fried rice, Mongolian venison or beef, Mongolian beancurd and the sambal kangkong. This serves 2-3 or more depending on the portion you order. If you are into sailing, Constant Winds operates Belly View so you can always check out the courses there. Make sure you make a reservation or aunty won't be pleased. That also guarantees you a good seat by the waterfront.

address: 11 Changi Coast Walk NSRCC Sea Sports Centre Singapore 499740 Singapore
comment: This is a regular stop for us on our weekend bike rides. Â It's perfect because you can ride your bike right up to the table where you can sit and watch the planes come in. Â It's very quiet, and removed from the hustle and bustle of the city. Â The menu is small, but sufficient for breakfast: Â eggs, pancakes, toast, and maybe a milkshake for dessert :) Â The coffee is pretty decent as they have a proper espresso machine for lattes.

address: 1010 East Coast Parkway Carpark C3@ ECP Singapore 449892 Singapore
comment: Moving forwards, think I will try to write reviews when the experience is still fresh. There are many reviews which I wanted to write, but as I did not take notes other than the captions in the Yelp pictures, I often find it difficult to write reviews after some time has passed.Ok, I digress - back to the review. Visited this 7-month old Georges Beach Club for the first time tonight. Have passed by it many times but we decided to try it out tonight. They have indoor and outdoor seating. This evening was nice and really breezy at the beach, so we opted for al fresco seating.Giving it a 3-stars for the following reasons:1. Food quality - 3 stars: We had Ribs (quite good), Pasta Marinara (below par) and Seafood Platter (ok). Overall verdict of food is that it is probably of a-ok standards. I'll love to be proven wrong in future visits though. 2. Ambience- Â 4 stars: Very nice to sit outdoors in the evenings when there is breeze. Opt for the last table to the left: Here, you get to watch the sun set as well as get a good view of the beach. Very chillax environment.3. Service - 3.5 stars: Service was adequate and quite attentive.4. Live Band & Live Sports Telecast: Saw that they have live bands on Thurs to Sat. May drop by next time to take a look. They have a pool table indoors with Live Sports Telecast of EPL matches. This would be good for sports fans and pool enthusiasts. This outlet is linked to their more famous 7 year old outlet at Siglap. They have outlets at Pasir Ris and Punggol too. Their chillout atmosphere will make me drop by again in the near future.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Be ready to have to wait a bit here. Â It is a local favorite, in the suburbs of SG. Â Most fresh rotis are pretty good too, but this place shines above and beyond (in a diminishing returns sort-of-way) by having slightly better dough, better hand/grease/slap/rotate action, and the crispiness of their roti. The gravy served with is also pretty good. Â I would definitely come by again if I was nearby, otherwise your local roti place is probably not too far away. Â Though this still is the best roti I've had, i'm not sure if its worth the wait and distance from the city.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: We ate at 8am on a Mon and food was ready within 10 minutes. You order, wait for your number to be called, pay and pickup your food. Be sure to try some sambal that is available at pickup area. Prata is extra crisp but small. We had to order more and ate 3 per person.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Delicious roti Prata. They have vegetarian curry available. I tried the plain, onion and cheese and cheese only one but honestly the plain was the best. Worth the trip and line. Cheap too- I think my whole meal was $6 sgd.... can't beat that. A tiger beer costs only $4 for a small. Great breakfast meal!!!

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Came by the other day for breakfast and it was an odd experience. Placed an order with the Mrs. And she told me to sit down in the ventilated but still hot and humid dining room. After a good 10-15 minutes in the sweltering heat, went back up to the Mrs. And she quickly brought out my Roti Pratha...Weird.The roti was light and flaky. The curry sauce was okay, nothing to write home about. For $1 it was definitely a local experience!

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: I have not had a good roti prata in ages. Finally fount it here at this joint. I am very please at how delicious the prata is--light and crisp on the outside, and not greasy. The curry sauce is quite nice. The plain prata is the best. The size of the prat is small so order three if you want a full breakfast.Definitely will return. When I crave for prata, this is where I want to go to.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Really cheap and probably worth 5 stars except the wait was extremely long (didn't time it but it was between 30min-hour). As other reviews stated, it's not greasy. Just delicious. At approx $1d, it's great value. Note they were serving many different types of rotis. They all looked the same to me on the menu, so I'm not sure how to differentiate when ordering.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Can't believe I forgot to review this place four months ago. And so I waited, biding my time until I could next fly out and enjoy the best prata I've ever eaten in my life. I booked my accommodation so I could be close to this stall, not even kidding. It's a tiny setup located within a restaurant on Crane Street. Open in the mornings until early afternoon it's a mum and pop stall that makes only prata. A local spot in a quiet part of town. My favourite is the plain prata. I've had it with egg and onion which was good, and also with cheese which I'm pretty sure was Kraft cheese slices. Served alongside curry sauce for dipping, it's a sheer delight. Three prata and coffee with milk (ordered separately through the restaurant) this me back $4.00. My favourite local cheap eat in Singapore and the best prata ever. It's crispy and moreish but not greasy and dense. An absolute must if you're visiting the area.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Ordered two roti kosong as I believe it is a better way to access the roti quality.I went for the mutton curry instead of the default curry.The roti size is typical, about 14cm in diameter.Although it is advertised as crispy, I do not considered my roti came crispy but rather hard and dried. I also realised that the roti are not squashed after being taken off the cooking hotplate as was done traditionally. This, I was made to believe, is what makes the roti crispy and soft.I was disappointed that my muttom curry was not spicy at all and the curry texture was quite different from the others. However, the mutton was well cooked, tender and succulent.It was a Sunday morning as I stepped into the coffee shop, the stall opens at 6.30am and the crowd started coming in as early as 7 am.Car parking is limited.I did not find the motivating factor to make a repeat visit but lets see.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: The best!!!The safest food and natural homemade ready crispy fried so good top it off with curry sauce heaven in the morning

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Absolutely delicious roti prata! Â The trek to get there was a bit far for me, however it was worth it. I got the plain, egg, and mushroom and cheese. It comes with curry on the side to dip the roti prata. My favorite was the plain, others were good as well but it doesn't beat the flakiness and crispiness of the plain.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Yes, YES, YAAAAAAAAAAS!I love me some prata, and this one's the prata to beat all pratas.This stall has a very humble setting in a bustling coffee shop off Joo Chiat Road. If you walk up and happen to be 2nd or 3rd in the queue, don't be surprised if there are 5+ people ahead of you who put in big orders and are waiting on the side!Menu is pretty straightforward; I ordered their plain prata and tried the onion and egg one. If you're having it there, the order guy will write down your order on the clip board and simply say "Okay, I'll call you."Grab a table, order some teh or kopi, and wait. If you can, remember who was in front of you so you have an idea when your order comes up. Don't be surprised if it's been 15 minutes. If the guy wrote down your order, it will come! Also, it'd be good to REMEMBER your order so if he asks for a refresher, you can easily let him know.My wait was fruitful. I got crispy, not-too-greasy prata that filled me up through mid-afternoon, and of course the sauces that came with it were boss.This is the real deal and I will return.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Who doesn't love Roti Prata! Especially one as crispy and mouthwatering as Mr and Mrs Mohgan's Prata. Amazingly, not oily at all! Lines can be long depending on what time of day you go, especially with some patrons making some large orders. This is definitely the Prata gem of the Joo Chiat area.Personally, I would stick with the plain Prata to get a real sense of how good the Prata skin really is. I found that the egg and onion Prata I ordered diluted the crispyness/taste of the skin.4-stars for the worldly Prata, but dock one star because of the limited selection. I'm a sucker for egg and banana Prata, which was not available at this stall. :D

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Once or if we're lucky, twice every year we get to fly to the Food Paradise that is Singapore. This is one of our "go to" food centres when we're in Singapore because of it's proximity to our lodging with family.Usually the tell-tale sign of a good dish or chef is the lines out the front but I think some people just enjoy lining up for food at times in Singapore without their being any substance behind the food for my tastes but Mr and Mrs Moghan's Super Crispy Prata is well worth the wait.Prata is basically an unleavened bread that is expertly flipped near on like a pizza is and moulded until it has many thin layers of pastry, like a croissant. Prata is usually crispy and flaky on the outside, whilst remaining doughy on the inside. It makes a great breakfast, brunch or lunch but I can eat it any time of day and it is so incredibly more-ish. The Prata is always super crispy as promised in their name and the curry is always nice to dip the prata in, as is tradition. Although you can wait a little to find a seat, it's well worth it or you can always take away or Ta Pao in the local Singlish (Singapore/English) lingo.I'd also recommend that people look inside for seats too when seeking a seat as although it's a little warmer in the humidity of Singapore, quite often it's easier to sneak a seat and don't park illegally as you will most likely get a ticket.The little refreshments store serves up Iced Horlicks too which I can't help but get one every time we head there. I love the malty, milky goodness to kick off the day.Like anywhere in Singapore that serves at breakfast, I'd recommend getting there early as often places sell out.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Good roti prata!! Wait, and your order is taken, and they write it on a paper and grab a seat. That's about it. Pretty simple. You pay when you get the order. They make it all fresh and so you'll get a hot prata that isn't super greasy like some places.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: ALERT ALERT ALERT!!! They Vacated Crane Lane please head to the coffee shop next to Dunman Hawker Centre. Â Read about it only after eating the current prata - terrible.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Well I don't actually write review. But I'm compelled to write for this one since I was basing my hunt based on yelp info. Went there an hour before they closed (yelp said 1:30) and the Indian lady straightaway said they are closing. It was a total bummer. We came all the way from California and were excited for this one. We left walking under the blazing hot noon sun with a hungry bellies looking for the next place to eat. Thanks Yelp and thanks Mr And Mrs Mohgan for the "kind" hospitality".

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Had excellent prata here. The mushroom cheese prata I ordered came piping hot and oozing with cheese. Definitely recommend this place.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Probably one of the best Prata in Singapore. Really love the crispy prata especially their egg prata.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Plenty of seating outside away from the smoky griddle. Â Parking is quite limited.The roti pratas were crispy on the outside and very stretchy on the inside. Â The thick and chunky curry included was a daal curry with a surprising bit of mutton flap meat. Â It looks like there was a upgrade option for the curry to full mutton chunks but i missed it on the menu.Roti prata was $1.00 each for plain. $0.50 for egg, $0.80 for mushrooms and $0.30 for onion. Kopi and other drinks, as well as nasi lemak, offered by vendor sharing same space.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: The name of this place is very true to the experience. There was Mrs Mohgan taking order and handing out the dishes and Mr Mohgan making the fresh prata's to order. Â No frills and all good food. Â Go early to get a comfy plastic seat. Â A hidden gem so I'm a little reluctant to write about this but it's too good not to tell others. Â I tried 1 cheese and 1 onion Prata with a side of fish curry. Â Many others had kofe with their breakfast too. Â Off the beaten path but worth a visit if you want some good local fare. Made another local foodie friend so all in all it was a great random stop.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Laaaiiiiiiiiiiiii liaaaaaooooooooo!!!Gotta love the drink store brothers... Classic hokkien rhymes at its best (:Good honest couple churning out roti prata with passion. Seriously one of the best in my opinion. Do make a trip down , give it a go, no regrets .

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: First time here! We enjoyed a selection of four pratas: egg, cheese, onion and mushroom. Taste - very good (and crispy as advertised) ... lite and not oilyQuality - actually much better we think than the prata on KillineyPresentation - are you kidding? If you're local, it's really the taste and quality that count. But presentation is authentic and on a stainless steel plate with three condiments/curries tooService - the Mrs. is very polite (the Mr. and associate rotated in their prata prep and cooking)Ambience - open air on the corner with inside (within the building and sidewalk) and outside (on the sidewalk) seatingCost: Couldn't go wrong for ~ S$6 for two with the healthy-size prata servings. Â We also had two hot coffees too at S$1 each from a next door vendor. Â Think cost and value are the key factors after taste and quality. Definitely a repeat-go-back-to-dining destination. And, yes, there can be folks waiting for their orders (even at 8 in the morning) but I observed the Mrs. does maintain a good awareness on each of the individuals/families whose order is whose as she writes them down on her hanging clip board. Popular with locals from all backgrounds. Â A definite recommendation. Â And compliments to the Mr. and Mrs. and the support folks too. We can appreciate the place's popularity.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: I would not say I am a big fan of roti prata. I probably eat it less than 5 times a year. But I love the prata here!Crispy and not oily. Served to you freshly fried. I like my prata to have a good doughy bite plus a crispy outer skin and this one is totally it. You can request for fish curry to go with your prata too which is a little more tangy than meaty curry.On weekends, the wait can be quite long. Thank god I don't live near here or I can imagine putting on the pounds. A totally cheap and yummy breakfast for less than $1 for a kosong prata.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: The fish curry sauce is very good but the prata is not so - crispy on the outside but not fluffy inside and I need to extract unexpanded dough out.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: It is a great local restaurant that provides many choices of food. Many residents come with their family for feeding themselves. It is just near to the hotel where I stay for a night. If you want to get some cheaper food for your fresh morning, it is a nice place to eat casually.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Excellent prata. Crispy but not oily. Had 3 kosong bawang pratas with mutton and fish curry. Will try cheese, mushroom and egg pratas next time.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Simple, cheap and good, it's a great prata experience for breakfast or lunch. It's in a little coffees hop on Crane Road so it's all pretty no frills, but if you eat in the prata is fresh, which is all you need!

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Naaaaaaasty, FILTHY & Ruuuuuuddde!!!!!!I'm staying down the street from this place and saw all the kind reviews...This place was absolutely filthy there is a wait station near the front that was covered in splattered sauce and noodles - yuuuuck!!! The place is open to the street and they are working on the sewer, yes the sewer!! I walked to the back and thought I would order, I asked about the menu and just received a retort from a sweaty man, "NO MENU!!". The people working in the kitchen looked similarly sweaty and dirty. The kitchen stunk. What a filth hole! Singapoeans have a great deal of pride in the cleanliness of their country; the health authorities are definitely letting one slip here!!!

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Long queues, crispy prata, long wait, quite stuffy and not a convenient location. Would revisit on a cooler less crowded day if I stayed nearby.

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Nestled in a corner of a traditional open air restaurant space, shared with three other hawkers is the purveyor of the best crispy roti prata. Mr M is making each one to order. Mrs M playing up. The queues are long but together they churn out the goods. A favorite breakfast place for me on Sunday's. Not easy to get there from Marina Bay but I make the effort. I recommend that you do too!

rest_name: Mr and Mrs Mohganâs Super Crispy Roti Prata
comment: Although a relative newbie in the hawker scene, Mr & Mrs Mohgan's Super Crispy Roti Prata have been consistently ranked as one of the top roti prata vendors in Singapore. Manned by the gentle, soft-spoken couple whose eponymous stall is distinguished by its unabating lines, you're happy to wait in a stuffy, old-school coffeeshop that's as dank as it is rank. Because you're ultimately rewarded for your sweaty efforts with a heaping plate of the best prata I've had in a very long time. I'm partial to Egg Prata ($1.40), and these were beautifully crispy, torched with a golden hue, while fluffy and chewy inside. What's most surprising, however, was how little ghee and oil was used; there was hardly a trace of oil left on the plate when I was done.The default curry accompanying pratas is the Dhal Cha, a thick, beany yellow lentil-based curry that the chilli-averse will likely take to. Should you prefer a more meaty or spicier curry, there's the fish or the mutton.

address: 3 Changi Business Park Central 1 Capri Hotel - Changi Centre Point Singapore 486037 Singapore
comment: This is an update to an earlier review.This is based on a team lunch I hosted. Â The lunch was for a party of ten.As with my first visit, the staff was friendly and professional and, overall, the service was very good. Â They did not have any issues dealing with the needs of a larger group.From my first review and still accurate:"The ambiance is clean and modern. Â At lunch, the restaurant was only half full."The main reason I am updating my review is the burger. Â In my first review, I wrote quite positively about their burger. Â I ordered it again. Â While it looked the same, it did not taste the same. Â The meat did not taste good at all. Â Two other people ordered the burger and they agreed that it was not very good. Â The remainder of the group seemed to enjoy their meals. Â A number of them had one of the set menus. Â For lunch, the menu options are a bit limited though.tinyurl.com/b8kkdh4Some had the Beef Green Curry with Jasmine Ricetinyurl.com/bc7nbchOthers tried the Pasta Aribiatatinyurl.com/d335nrjThe set menus also included Seafood Chowder and a Frozen treat.tinyurl.com/bjxvlojtinyurl.com/amfn4e5Overall - I am not going to reduce their score to three stars. Â I will be wary in ordering their burger again. Â It is a shame they changed the beef. Â It was really good before. Â The set menu options are neatly presented and folks seemed to enjoy them. Â While nothing flashy, the ambiance and service help contribute to a nice lunc experience.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Rd #02-02, Bedok Mall Bedok, Singapore Singapore
comment: Nene Chicken seems to be franchising a lot in eastern Singapore. 75% of their outlets are located in the east. My colleague who's a fan of it also mentioned that they are allegedly the No. 1 chicken franchise in Korea, its founding country. *shrugs* I always felt that the outlet here is quite cram, but my colleague argued that this one is even bigger than all the other Nene Chicken outlets she had visited. I can only wonder how small the others are. The only other outlet I've ever been to was the one at Scape; and I guess due to the outdoor location, I felt it was big.Anyhows, making the order can be quite confusing if it's your first time, since their menu is not exactly itemized. So each customer will usually spend some time at the counter, busying the serving staff with questions.This is also the first ever eatery I've dined in whereby they provide plastic hand-gloves for you to eat your food. The first time I did, my first remark was, "What?! Are you kidding me?" But it's only after you look around and start digging into your food that you will begin to appreciate them. Everybody is using them. Eating the chickens will be a one messy feat. Just be careful not to bite and chew the plastic instead.If you think you're up for the 'Freaking Hot' set, brace your tongue. It's gonna burn! Really burn. I've also tried the 'Snowing Cheese' set, but with the tenders version. Nice. Always been a cheese lover. However today, we got the classic hot chickens along with another set of 'Swicy' chickens. Sweet + Spicy = Swicy!Topped with roasted sesame seeds, with really lovely sauce... I loved them! And oh! You have to try the fries. If you love McDonald's Twister Fries, you'll like these too. Sure they're not curly, but taste almost the same; at least to my tastebuds.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Avenue 1 #01-30 UE BizHub East Singapore 486017 Singapore
comment: Update from my last review:Prices for the breakfast set has gone up to $7.90 now but still affordable for the quality u're getting! Plus they've got a whole range of new stuffs on their menu. Pimp your own salad! ice cream sandwiches (yeah u know the ones that they sell at Penny Uni too?) and homemade porridge (the western kind) & yoghurt with fresh fruits and chia seeds.Bumping them up to 4stars as they've been consistently good :)

address: 6 Changi Business Park Avenue 1 #01-30 UE BizHub East Singapore 486017 Singapore
comment: This is a review of a solo takeout lunch from Knead to Eat at UE BizHub East.tinyurl.com/c8u9t25This is one of the restaurants that has recently opened in the UE BizHub East Building located in the Changi Business area.The staff is extremely friendly and responsive.The shop area is clean and well kept. Â There are not a whole lot of seats so take-out may be the way to go.Brutus Roast Beef Sandwich - This was a very good sandwich made from quality ingredients. Â This is NOT just packaged roast beef thrown on a bun. Â It is obvious the meat is cooked in some kind of seasoning that makes it quite tasty. Â  The sautÃ©ed mushrooms and caramelized onions come together quite well. Â It is also a sizable sandwich. Â The ciabatta bread was very good. Â There are other bread option offered. tinyurl.com/bnzdholCost: The sandwich cost $10.90.They do need to add some chips and other sides. Â While I was eating the sandwich, I was thinking some salty crisps would go quite well with this.Overall - Knead to Eat provided a very nice sandwich. Â The staff was great. Â It was reasonably quick.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Avenue 1 #01-30 UE BizHub East Singapore 486017 Singapore
comment: A quick post based on a quick lunchtime visit to a new coffee and sandwich place in Changi Business park.Until the last year or so, there were few options for coffee drinkers in Changi business park - a sliding scale starting at vending machine coffee, reaching convenience store coffee and ending at withdrawal symptoms from giving up altogether. These were not good options. The arrival of a new shopping mall and even more office space has seen a corresponding increase the availability of coffee, from the ever present franchise chains, to quirky and interesting places such as Table Manners and Knead to Eat. Espresso - there was a small volume of liquid with a light brown crema, so the beans were not stale. The size was consistent with a single shot, so it's unlikely to have been over or under extracted. The first impression was of woody elements with a little bit of bitterness, overall a nicely balanced shot. Not too bitter, with pleasant woody notes and all in all a decent effort.Cappuccino - the serving size is quite large, It's far too milky though, I couldn't taste any coffee. The execution was ok (microbubbles were there, the ratio of foam to milk was correct) but it's just too diluted. Shame to see a good underlying espresso buried under a tsunami of milk, and losing the interesting character that it had. Lattes on the other hand are well executed, and above all else, they're potent! There's a robust coffee flavour from the first sip. The milk has hardly reduced the coffee flavour, and this is a good thing - it's a bold and interesting coffee. The mouthfeel is fine - foam mixes with the milk nicely. Latte art is nicely done.
